issue.title: GraphQL error when editing comment on PR

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Issue identified by VS Code Team member as probable bug

issue.body:
Issue Type: Bug 1. Check out a PR for review 2. Add a comment to the main discussion thread 3. Edit comment & Save Expected Results: The comment is edited and saved Actual Results: The comment looks like it saved but I get a toast in VSCode with the following error: > GraphQL error: Could not resolve to PullRequestReviewComment node with the global id of 'xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx=='. The comment textarea leaves edit mode and looks like it saved but if I refresh the PR screen the comment re-enters edit mode. Extension version: 0.17.0 VS Code version: Code 1.46.0 (a5d1cc28bb5da32ec67e86cc50f84c67cc690321, 2020-06-10T08:59:06.977Z) OS version: Darwin x64 19.4.0
System Info |Item|Value| |---|---| |CPUs|Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-4870HQ CPU @ 2.50GHz (8 x 2500)| |GPU Status|2d_canvas: enabled
flash_3d: enabled
flash_stage3d: enabled
flash_stage3d_baseline: enabled
gpu_compositing: enabled
metal: disabled_off
multiple_raster_threads: enabled_on
oop_rasterization: disabled_off
protected_video_decode: unavailable_off
rasterization: enabled
skia_renderer: disabled_off_ok
video_decode: enabled
viz_display_compositor: enabled_on
viz_hit_test_surface_layer: disabled_off_ok
webgl: enabled
webgl2: enabled| |Load (avg)|2, 2, 2| |Memory (System)|16.00GB (1.47GB free)| |Process Argv|| |Screen Reader|no| |VM|0%|

issue.title: Cannot edit PR review: resource not accessible by integration

labels.name: info-needed
labels.description: Issue requires more information from poster

issue.body:
When attempting to edit an existing but not yet submitted PR review comment, GitHub Codespaces emits the following error:
```
GraphQL error: Resource not accessible by integration
```
This was observed both with the release version and the pre-release (v0.75.2023100909) versions.

GitHub Codespace version information:
```
Version: 1.83.0
Commit: e7e037083ff4455cf320e344325dacb480062c3c
Date: 2023-10-03T16:11:43.025Z
Browser: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/117.0.0.0 Safari/537.36
```

Thanks for looking into it.

comment.body:
It looks like this is an issue with GitHub Codespaces and the auth token they provide. I'm getting help from them. 

@TylerLeonhardt FYI

issue.title: how i fix this?

labels.name: info-needed
labels.description: Issue requires more information from poster

issue.body:
023-10-15 19:16:40.405 [error] Unexpected non-whitespace character after JSON at position 1206: SyntaxError: Unexpected non-whitespace character after JSON at position 1206
    at JSON.parse (<anonymous>)
    at Object.factory (c:\Users\GhazalCO\AppData\Local\Programs\MicrosoftVSCode\resources\app\out\vs\code\node\sharedProcess\sharedProcessMain.js:99:85837)

comment.body:
Hey @alexr00 !

Not sure how to reproduce it. But here are the events that let this error happen in my case.

**Context**
* I previously had vscode installed on my machine but I hardly used it. But I remember that I installed a couple of extensions in it using the vscode GUI options. Those were successful installs.
* Then recently I thought to upgrade vscode to the new version, so I uninstalled the older vscode and downloaded the 1.83.1 version to install.
* Installation was successful.
* Then I went to install extensions. But this time instead of installing extensions through GUI, I attempted to install these through command line. I attempted to install a [lot of extensions](https://github.com/CuriousLearner/dotfiles/blob/master/setup/vscode/install-extensions.sh) in a single command like
```shell
code --install-extension bradlc.vscode-tailwindcss --force &
code --install-extension budparr.language-hugo-vscode --force &
code --install-extension charliermarsh.ruff --force &
...
```
* half of the installation went smooth, then in the middle I started receiving this error message
```
[error] SyntaxError: Unexpected non-whitespace character after JSON at position 29622
    at JSON.parse (<anonymous>)
    at Object.factory (/Applications/Visual Studio Code.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/code/node/sharedProcess/sharedProcessMain.js:99:85837)
```
* since then, I am unable install packages via GUI option, everytime I try I get this error in logs.
* I have tried uninstalling, re-installing it doesn't help.
* I am on MacOS ventura 13.6
* This is happening in vscode 1.83.1


comment.body: Awesome. Thank you for all the details. I can repro.

issue.title: When using workspace with two repos, commenting is only available in the first repo
issue.body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill some of these. -->

- Extension version:
v0.74.1
- VSCode Version:
1.83.1 (system setup)
- OS:
Win11 (Windows_NT x64 10.0.22621)
- Repository Clone Configuration (single repository/fork of an upstream repository):
Single
- Github Product (Github.com/Github Enterprise version x.x.x):
Enterprise

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open the root folder of a repo in VS Code.
2. Add another folder to the workspace.
3. Open the Pull Requests view
4. Click on a file from the pull request file tree of the first repo you opened in VS Code
5. Notice how you can add comments. Both in diff view and file view:
![9818324b-a351-43d7-9e49-b96d797db788](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-pull-request-github/assets/3394270/97cf8fae-d8a1-49a9-a910-92ef80c10ec4)
6. Now click on a file from the pull request file tree of the SECOND repo you opened
7. Notice how the grey line isn't there anymore, neither in diff view of in file view:
![40d87b22-42a5-44d7-b708-993dbedee4a8](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-pull-request-github/assets/3394270/2daf1131-702a-4ea2-a829-c6509761af56)

The extension seems to only add the commenting capability to the _first_ folder in your workspace, because if I open the workspace settings (JSON) and flip the order of the elements in the `folders` array, then I can suddenly start making comments in the other folder, but no longer in the one I opened initially.

issue.title: Provide an option not to hide lines of a PR

labels.name: info-needed
labels.description: Issue requires more information from poster

issue.body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
Searched and didn't found any
<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
I have observed hidden lines from the last few days while checking the diff. The whole point of me reviewing PR in VS Code is so I can jump to other places of code and understand. it's annoying to click show all lines for all the diffs. It would be nice to have a setting for this, so if anyone like me who wants to see the whole file, instead of hidden lines that would be great

comment.body: something like this

issue.title: Generates a large number of uncaught errors on WSL2.

labels.name: info-needed
labels.description: Issue requires more information from poster

issue.body:
Type: Bug Expected: The extension works normally, like most other extensions installed on WSL2, w/o generating many uncaught errors. Actual: Extension consistently generates considerable uncaught errors during normal day-to-day VS Code operations in WSL2. During the time it took to create this PR, and with no apparent interaction on my part, errors have increased from 29 to 36; I can see the counter incrementing in the background while I type. Repro: - Install the `GitHub Pull Requests and Issues` extension on VS Code in WSL2. - Grant the requested permissions, thereby adding the extension to the list of Trusted Extensions. - Perform normal VS Code operations for a minute or two. - Open VS Code workbench command input and select `Developer: Restart Extension Host`. - Action should fail, generating a prompt; choose the option to reload. - Wait for the extension host to perform the initial load sequence. - Open the Extensions tab in the Sidebar, click the `...` icon in the upper right corner, and select `Show Running Extensions` from the popup menu. - Use the view that opens in the main editor to scroll until `GitHub Pull Requests and Issues` is located. - Check for either a **_hung extension_** (status will show "activating" even after 10-15 minutes) or **_one or more uncaught extension errors_** (possibly actively incrementing higher and higher). Additional details: This is not necessarily a new issue. I have uninstalled this extension several times due to uncaught errors and the accompanying latency (real or perceived) it creates in VS Code. However, I cannot be sure the cause of the errors has remained identical since I have never attempted to debug it. Extension version: 0.70.0 VS Code version: Code 1.81.1 (6c3e3dba23e8fadc360aed75ce363ba185c49794, 2023-08-09T22:22:42.175Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.22631 Modes: Remote OS version: Linux x64 5.15.90.4-microsoft-standard-WSL2
System Info |Item|Value| |---|---| |CPUs|Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-1035G4 CPU @ 1.10GHz (8 x 1498)| |GPU Status|2d_canvas: enabled
canvas_oop_rasterization: disabled_off
direct_rendering_display_compositor: disabled_off_ok
gpu_compositing: enabled
multiple_raster_threads: enabled_on
opengl: enabled_on
rasterization: enabled
raw_draw: disabled_off_ok
video_decode: enabled
video_encode: enabled
vulkan: disabled_off
webgl: enabled
webgl2: enabled
webgpu: enabled| |Load (avg)|undefined| |Memory (System)|7.60GB (1.10GB free)| |Process Argv|--file-uri=vscode-remote://wsl+Ubuntu/home/sth13/code/reporg/galactic/hl/helplisted/helplisted.code-workspace --remote=wsl+Ubuntu --crash-reporter-id 4da9c5cf-4181-4cf3-92d8-15b99c279d21| |Screen Reader|yes| |VM|0%| |Item|Value| |---|---| |Remote|WSL: Ubuntu| |OS|Linux x64 5.15.90.4-microsoft-standard-WSL2| |CPUs|Intel(R) Core(TM) i5-1035G4 CPU @ 1.10GHz (6 x 1497)| |Memory (System)|5.36GB (2.92GB free)| |VM|0%|
A/B Experiments ``` vsliv368cf:30146710 vsreu685:30147344 python383:30185418 vspor879:30202332 vspor708:30202333 vspor363:30204092 vslsvsres303:30308271 vserr242cf:30382550 pythontb:30283811 vsjup518:30340749 pythonptprofiler:30281270 vshan820:30294714 vstes263cf:30335440 vscoreces:30445986 vscod805cf:30301675 binariesv615:30325510 bridge0708:30335490 bridge0723:30353136 vsaa593cf:30376535 pythonvs932:30410667 vscaac:30438847 vsclangdc:30486549 c4g48928:30535728 dsvsc012cf:30540253 pynewext54:30695312 azure-dev_surveyone:30548225 vscccc:30803845 282f8724:30602487 f6dab269:30613381 showlangstatbar:30737416 03d35959:30757346 pythonfmttext:30731395 pythoncmvfstrcf:30756944 fixshowwlkth:30771522 showindicator:30805244 pythongtdpath:30769146 i26e3531:30792625 gsofa:30804715 pythonnosmt12:30797651 pythonidxptcf:30805731 pythonnoceb:30805159 dsvsc013:30795093 dsvsc014:30804076 diffeditorv1:30812748 ```
![Screenshot 2023-08-18 020135](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-pull-request-github/assets/47695475/53cea3b2-b6b9-4c51-957c-f1854742ca88)

comment.body: @alexr00, yes it could, as VS Code does not store the passphrase when authenticating with an SSH key that uses a passphrase (similar as we do not store the password). When using an SSH key we always recommend following [this documentation](https://docs.github.com/en/authentication/connecting-to-github-with-ssh/working-with-ssh-key-passphrases), to avoid entering the passphrase on every request.

issue.title: Command to go to next diff section in PR

labels.name: info-needed
labels.description: Issue requires more information from poster

issue.body:
Is there a command which could move focus to the next section of diff in a PR? "workbench.action.compareEditor.nextChange" can do this but it is only for a given file, and cannot move focus to the diff in the next file if it reaches the end of current source file.

Not sure if "pr.goToNextDiffInPr" can do it and haven't tried it successfully.

comment.body: That should work across files until it gets to the last change in the "last" file, at which point it shows a notification. Do you see the nofication?

issue.title: Command to go to next diff section in PR

labels.name: info-needed
labels.description: Issue requires more information from poster

issue.body:
Is there a command which could move focus to the next section of diff in a PR? "workbench.action.compareEditor.nextChange" can do this but it is only for a given file, and cannot move focus to the diff in the next file if it reaches the end of current source file.

Not sure if "pr.goToNextDiffInPr" can do it and haven't tried it successfully.

![Image](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-pull-request-github/assets/25044782/c407b064-539d-4b0a-9099-e21be8b388ad)
